New York University Archives
Howard Cann Collection
Cann, Howard
MC 127
3 Linear Feet in 2 flat boxes
1915-1991 Howard Cann coached basketball for thirty-five years at New York University, from 1923-1958. Materials are primarily in English. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
Conditions Governing Access
Access to the Howard Cann Collection is restricted until materials are arranged and described by an archivist.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Biographical Note
Howard Goodsell Cann was a college basketball and football player, and an Olympic shot putter. He coached basketball for thirty-five years at New York University, from 1923-1958. Materials in this collection include certificates, awards, and diplomas from various athletic associations honoring Cann's career as an athlete and coach. There are also certificates of honor from Cann's naval service and an American flag.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Howard Cann Collection; MC 127; box number; folder number or item identifier; New York University Archives, New York University.
Scope and Contents
These materials contain mainly certificates, awards and diplomas from various athletic associations honoring Howard Cann's career as an athlete and coach. Included as well are certificates of honor from Cann's naval service and an American flag.
Certificates. Awards. Memorabilia.
